name: Giant Hyssop
climate: Giant Hyssop thrives in temperate climates where it can enjoy cool nights.
This plant is hardy and can tolerate a range of climate conditions.
Often found in climates with moderate rainfall and mild winters.
It prefers a climate where there is plenty of sunshine during the day.
sunlight: Giant Hyssop requires full sun to thrive and develop vibrant flowers.
It can tolerate partial shade but performs best in full sunlight conditions.
Ensuring at least six to eight hours of sunlight will enhance growth.
Sunlight is essential for the best blooming results and robust health.
watering: Keep the soil consistently moist, especially during the growing season.
It requires moderate watering; avoid waterlogging to prevent root rot.
Drought-tolerant once established but benefits from weekly watering.
Water deeply, allowing the top inch of soil to dry between waterings.
soil: Giant Hyssop prefers well-drained soil rich in organic matter.
It grows well in sandy loam but can tolerate poor quality soils.
Soil pH should be slightly acidic to neutral for optimal growth.
Adding compost can improve soil texture and provide nutrients.
extra_care_tip: Deadheading spent flowers encourages continuous blooming.
Provide support as plants can become top-heavy when in full bloom.
